sen.j: 愛宕信仰（あたごしんこう）とは、京都市の愛宕山 (京都市)山頂に鎮座する愛宕神社 (京都市)から発祥した、火防の神に対する神道の信仰である。
sen.e: "Atago-shinko Faith" is a Shinto faith towards fire prevention, which originated at the Atago-jinja Shrine (Kyoto City) enshrined on the top of Atago-yama Mountain in Kyoto City.
"Atago-shinko Faith" is a Shinto faith about fire prevention, which originated at the Atago-jinja Shrine (Kyoto City) enshrined on the top of Mount Atago-yama in Kyoto City.
"Atago-shinko faith" is a Shinto faith about fire prevention, which originated at the Atago-jinja Shrine (Kyoto City) enshrined on the top of Mt. Atago in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: faithの頭文字を小文字にしました。"Mt. Atago"としました。

sen.j: 愛宕山の愛宕神社は、古くから修験道の道場となり、愛宕山に集まった修験者によって江戸時代中頃から愛宕信仰が日本全国に広められた。
sen.e: Atago-jinja Shrine on Atago-yama Mountain was a hall for shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) from long ago, and Atago-shinko Faith spread all over Japan from the mid-Edo period by shugendo practitioners gathering on Atago-yama Mountain.

Atago-jinja Shrine on Mount Atago-yama was a hall for shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) from long ago, and Atago-shinko Faith spread all over Japan from the mid-Edo period by shugendo practitioners gathering on Mount Atago-yama.

Atago-jinja Shrine on Mt. Atago was a hall for shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) from long ago, and Atago-shinko faith spread all over Japan from the mid-Edo period by shugendo practitioners gathering on Mt. Atago.
sen.cmt: faithの頭文字を小文字、および"Mt. Atago"としました。

sen.j: 中世後期以降、愛宕の神は火伏せに霊験のある神として広く信仰されるようになった。
sen.e: Since the late middle ages, the god of Atago was widely worshipped as a god with miraculous efficacy in fire prevention.

sen.j: 愛宕の神は神仏習合時代には地蔵菩薩を本地仏とした。
sen.e: The honjibutsu (original Buddhist divinity) of the god of Atago during times of syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism was Jizo Bosatsu.

sen.e: Since Shogun Jizo was the honjibutsu, it was worshipped not only as the god of fire prevention, but also as god of military arts.
